thread.title: Hope Solo tweets subtle insult at Maksim Chmerkovskiy
thread.title_full: Hope Solo tweets subtle insult at Maksim Chmerkovskiy - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Hope Solo tweets subtle insult at Maksim Chmerkovskiy
text:
Adam Taylor/ABC Former "Dancing with the Stars" partners Hope Solo and Maksim Chmerkovskiy have had a rocky relationship for years. There may be no Hope for reconciliation in a four-year-long "Dancing with the Stars" feud.
Olympic gold medalist Hope Solo, who has openly detested her former dance partner Maksim Chmerkovskiy since they competed on the show in 2011, tweeted a captionless photo early Wednesday of show judges Carrie Ann Inaba, Bruno Tonioli and Len Goodman each holding up a scoreboard of 1 out of 10.
The barb came seemingly in response to the Ukrainian ballroom dancer's comments during an episode of the "Allegedly" podcast released Tuesday, when he chose Solo as the one former dance partner he would "definitely kill" in a game of "F---, Marry, Kill."
DRUNKEN SOLO THREATENED COPS DURING 2014 ARREST: REPORT
"She's just a sh---y person," Chmerkovskiy told hosts Theo Von and Matthew Cole Weiss. "You can have a sh---y life growing up, you can have a tough upbringing, you can have history â€¦ but if you're just a bad person, there's no excuse for that."
The dysfunctional duo placed fourth on season 13 of ABC's competitive dancing show, and they've been at it for years.
In her 2012 book, "Solo: A Memoir of Hope," the 34-year-old soccer champ accused Chmerkovskiy , 35, of having been both verbally and physically aggressive during rehearsals.
